data.enText: throw
to throw sth lightly or carelessly

data.chText: 我把书丢在一边，站了起来。
data.enText: I tossed the book aside and got up.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: He tossed the ball to Anna.
He tossed Anna the ball.
your head

data.chText: 甩（头，以表示恼怒或不耐烦）
data.enText: to move your head suddenly upwards, especially to show that you are annoyed or impatient
She just tossed her head and walked off.
side to side/up and down
to move or make sb/sth move from side to side or up and down
Branches were tossing in the wind.

data.chText: 我彻夜在床上辗转反侧不能成眠。
data.enText: I couldn't sleep but kept tossing and turning in bed all night.

data.chText: 我们的船随着巨浪颠簸。
data.enText: Our boat was being tossed by the huge waves.
in cooking

data.chText: 摇匀；翻动（以沾油、奶酪等）
data.enText: to shake or turn food in order to cover it with oil, butter, etc.

data.chText: 把面条的汤控干，在溶化了的黄油里搅拌。
data.enText: Drain the pasta and toss it in melted butter.
to throw a pancake upwards so that it turns over in the air and you can fry the other side
coin
toss up (for sth)
to throw a coin in the air in order to decide sth, especially by guessing which side is facing upwards when it lands

data.chText: 只剩一张票，我来与你掷币决定给谁。
data.enText: There's only one ticket left─I'll toss you for it.

data.chText: 咱们掷硬币猜边儿决定吧。
data.enText: Let's toss a coin .

data.chText: 我们掷硬币决定谁先去。
data.enText: We tossed up to see who went first.

data.chText: 他不得不在付房租和买食品之间作出决定。
data.enText: He had to toss up between (= decide between) paying the rent or buying food.
toss off
toss sb/yourself off
to give yourself sexual pleasure by rubbing your sex organs; to give sb sexual pleasure by rubbing their sex organs
toss sth↔off

data.chText: 未经思索（或费力）很快做好
data.enText: to produce sth quickly and without much thought or effort
of coin
an act of throwing a coin in the air in order to decide sth

data.chText: 最后的结果是掷硬币决定的。
data.enText: The final result was decided on/by the toss of a coin .

data.chText: 猜中 / 猜错所掷硬币朝上的一面
data.enText: to win/lose the toss (= to guess correctly/wrongly which side of a coin will face upwards when it lands on the ground after it has been thrown in the air)
of head

data.chText: 向上甩头，猛仰头（尤指表示恼怒或不耐烦）
data.enText: an act of moving your head suddenly upwards, especially to show that you are annoyed or impatient

data.chText: 她一扬头，对这一问题不予理睬。
data.enText: She dismissed the question with a toss of her head.
throw
an act of throwing sth, especially in a competition or game
a toss of 10 metres
not give a toss (about sb/sth)
to not care at all about sb/sth
argue the toss

data.chText: （对决定）徒然反对，作无谓的争执
data.enText: to continue to disagree about a decision, especially when it is too late to change it or it is not very important

data.text: throw ♦ toss ♦ hurl ♦ fling ♦ chuck ♦ lob ♦ bowl ♦ pitch

data.chText: 以上各词均含扔、投、掷、抛之义。
data.enText: All these words mean to send sth from your hand through the air.
throw
to send sth from your hand or hands through the air

data.chText: 有些孩子在朝窗户扔石头。
data.enText: Some kids were throwing stones at the window.

data.chText: 她把球抛出来，他接住了。
data.enText: She threw the ball and he caught it.
toss

data.chText: 指轻轻或漫不经心地扔、抛、掷：
data.enText: to throw sth lightly or carelessly

data.chText: 她把她的短上衣丢到床上。
data.enText: She tossed her jacket onto the bed.
hurl
to throw sth violently in a particular direction

data.chText: 暴徒把一块砖猛地扔向汽车，砸破了挡风玻璃。
data.enText: Rioters hurled a brick through the car's windscreen.
fling

data.chText: 尤指生气地或急匆匆地用力扔、掷、抛、丢：
data.enText: to throw sb/sth somewhere with a lot of force, especially because you are angry or in a hurry
She flung the letter down onto the table.
chuck
( especially BrE informal ) to throw sth carelessly
I chucked him the keys.
lob

data.chText: 指往空中高扔、高抛、高掷：
data.enText: ( informal ) to throw sth so that it goes high through the air

data.chText: 他们在朝墙那边扔石头。
data.enText: They were lobbing stones over the wall.
bowl
(in cricket) to throw the ball to the batsman
pitch
(in baseball) to throw the ball to the batter
to throw/toss/hurl/fling/chuck/lob/bowl/pitch sth at/to sb/sth
to throw/toss/fling/chuck/lob sb sth
to throw/toss/hurl/fling/chuck sth aside/away
to throw/toss/hurl/fling/chuck/lob/bowl/pitch a ball
to throw/toss/hurl/fling/chuck/lob stones/a brick
to throw/toss/hurl/fling sth angrily
to throw/toss/fling/chuck sth casually/carelessly

means: 甩(头，以表示恼怒或不耐烦)
向上甩头，猛仰头(尤指表示恼怒或不耐烦)

ex.enText: He can throw a hundred yards.

ex.chText: 他投出了最后那颗手榴弹。

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指用力抛掷，不涉及动作方式或感情色彩。

ex.enText: How many times did he cast/throw his net every morning?

ex.chText: 别忘了往火堆里加木块。
ex.enText: Don't forget to cast more wood on the fire.

synonyms.bx: 多指迅速扔出一个较轻的物体，如书、球、包等，常可与 throw 换用。

ex.enText: He flung the coin into the river.

ex.chText: 毕业生们欢呼着把学士帽扔向空中。
ex.enText: The graduates cheered and flung their trencher caps into the air.

ex.chText: 她把文件往桌子上一摔便气冲冲地走了。
ex.enText: She flung the papers on the desk and left angrily.

synonyms.bx: 指用力投掷；也可指感情激动时粗鲁而随便地扔东西，此时常伴有某种较强烈的感情色彩。

ex.enText: He pitched the wallet into the box.

ex.chText: 他把那张名片扔进火里。
ex.enText: He pitched the name card into the fire.

synonyms.bx: 通常指仔细瞄准后用力地掷或扔，侧重方向性及明确的目标。

ex.chText: 他妻子把报纸扔给了他。
ex.enText: His wife tossed him the newspaper.

synonyms.bx: 尤指随意地扔、掷比较轻的东西，如书、报纸等。

data.enText: not give a toss (about sb/sth)
to not care at all about sb/sth
argue the toss

data.chText: （对决定）徒然反对，作无谓的争执
data.enText: to continue to disagree about a decision, especially when it is too late to change it or it is not very important
toss off
toss sb/yourself off
to give yourself sexual pleasure by rubbing your sex organs; to give sb sexual pleasure by rubbing their sex organs
toss sth↔off

data.chText: 未经思索（或费力）很快做好
data.enText: to produce sth quickly and without much thought or effort

tr: (sports) the act of throwing the ball to another member of your team
the act of flipping a coin
throw or toss with a light motion

example: The feverish patient thrashed around in his bed

tr: lightly throw to see which side comes up
example: I don't know what to do--I may as well flip a coin!

value.def: If you toss something somewhere, you throw it there lightly, often in a rather careless way.

example.ex: He screwed the paper into a ball and tossed it into the fire...
example.tran: 他把纸揉成一团扔进火里。

example.ex: He tossed his blanket aside and got up…
example.tran: 他把毯子掀到一边起了身。

example.ex: He tossed Malone a can of beer, and took one himself.
example.tran: 他扔给马隆一罐啤酒，自己也拿了一罐。

value.def: If you toss your head or toss your hair, you move your head backwards, quickly and suddenly, often as a way of expressing an emotion such as anger or contempt.

example.ex: 'I'm sure I don't know.' Cook tossed her head...
example.tran: “我确信我不知道。”库克一甩头说。

example.ex: Gasping, she tossed her hair out of her face.
example.tran: 她气喘吁吁地把头发从脸上甩开。

example.ex: With a toss of his head and a few hard gulps, Bob finished the last of his beer.
example.tran: 鲍勃猛一仰脖，咕嘟咕嘟几大口喝完了杯中剩下的啤酒。

value.tran: (常表示愤怒或轻蔑地)甩(头或头发)

value.def: In sports and informal situations, if you decide something by tossing a coin, you spin a coin into the air and guess which side of the coin will face upwards when it lands.

example.ex: We tossed a coin to decide who would go out and buy the buns.
example.tran: 我们掷硬币决定谁出去买小圆面包。

example.ex: It would be better to decide it on the toss of a coin.
example.tran: 还不如用抛硬币的方法来决定。

value.def: The toss is a way of deciding something, such as who is going to go first in a game, that consists of spinning a coin into the air and guessing which side of the coin will face upwards when it lands.

example.ex: Bangladesh won the toss and decided to bat first.
example.tran: 孟加拉国队掷硬币赢了，决定先击球。

value.def: If something such as the wind or sea tosses an object, it causes it to move from side to side or up and down.

example.ex: The seas grew turbulent, tossing the small boat like a cork...
example.tran: 海浪变得汹涌澎湃，把小船像漂浮的软木塞一样抛来甩去。

example.ex: As the plane was tossed up and down, the pilot tried to stabilise it.
example.tran: 飞机上下颠簸，飞行员试图将其稳住。

value.def: If you toss food while preparing it, you put pieces of it into a liquid and lightly shake them so that they become covered with the liquid.

example.ex: Do not toss the salad until you're ready to serve...
example.tran: 到快上菜时再轻轻搅拌色拉。

example.ex: Add the grated orange rind and toss the apple slices in the mixture...
example.tran: 加入磨碎的橙皮，再将苹果片在其中轻拌。

example.ex: Serve straight from the dish with a tossed green salad.
example.tran: 配上拌过了的田园色拉直接上桌。

value.def: If you say that someone argues the toss, you are criticizing them for continuing to argue for longer than is necessary about something that is not very important.

example.ex: They were still arguing the toss about the first goal...
example.tran: 他们仍在为第一个进球争论不休。

example.ex: They spend so much time arguing the toss over inconsequential matters.
example.tran: 他们花了这么多时间为无关紧要的事争个没完。

value.tran: 为不重要的事争论不休

value.def: If you say that you do not give a toss about someone or something, you are emphasizing that you do not care about them at all.

example.ex: Well, who gives a toss about sophistication anyway?...
example.tran: 嗯，不管怎样，谁会在意高雅时髦呢？

example.ex: I don't give a toss what people think…
example.tran: 我才不在乎人们怎么想呢。

example.ex: The rest of us really couldn't give a toss; money's what we want.
example.tran: 我们其余这些人根本不在乎：我们想要的就是钱。

gramarinfo.label: with brd-neg, V inflects, oft PHR <l>about</l> n, PHR wh

value.def: If you toss and turn, you keep moving around in bed and cannot sleep properly, for example because you are ill or worried.

example.ex: You feel as if you've been tossing and turning all night, and wake up feeling worn out.
example.tran: 感觉就像整夜翻来覆去睡不着、醒来时浑身疲惫一样。

trans: 为不重要的事争论不休
掷硬币；抛硬币；抛硬币决定问题；投硬币
